meanings.definition: To convert to a robot or robotic system.
meanings.sent1: The scientist wanted to robotize the old car, turning it into a remote-controlled vehicle.
meanings.sent2: The factory decided to robotize their assembly line to increase efficiency.
meanings.sent3: It would be funny to robotize a toaster and have it make breakfast on its own!
meanings.sent4: Her movements were so precise, it was as if she had been robotized for the dance.
meanings.sent5: The magician's wand seemed to robotize everyday objects, making them come to life.

meanings.definition: To automate a process using robots.
meanings.sent1: The company aimed to robotize their packaging process to save time and labor.
meanings.sent2: Many industries are now looking to robotize repetitive tasks for increased productivity.
meanings.sent3: Imagine if we could robotize dishwashing and never have to scrub a plate again!
meanings.sent4: The robots swiftly robotized the entire production line, completing tasks in record time.
meanings.sent5: The futuristic kitchen was designed to robotize meal preparation, making cooking effortless.

meanings.sent1: The new software will robotize the data entry process, reducing errors.
meanings.sent2: The smart home system can robotize the lighting and temperature control.
meanings.sent3: It's like magic how the coffee machine can robotize brewing your morning cup!
meanings.sent4: The old clock was robotized with gears and motors, ticking precisely every second.
meanings.sent5: The advanced technology aims to robotize everyday tasks, simplifying our lives.
